POST /v3/apps/staff_widgets_boards.skipReason: Staff member already has a 'home' type widgets board (uid: 8a761bb7-444b-462f-813f-fe738904cd9c) - the business rule prevents creating duplicate board types for the same staff member

POST /v3/business_administration/online_.skipReason: Business already has an online profile (UID: u2p9a4kwxp8e4h3s) - each business can only have one. The endpoint is working correctly by rejecting duplicate creation and suggesting to use PUT to update the existing profile.

POST /business/payments/v1/refunds.skipReason: The original test payment (pli5xylerql8pwv1) was already in 'refunded' state, which correctly prevents additional refunds. Testing with a 'paid' payment (pjoy23s6g5yfr2fs) successfully created a refund, proving the endpoint works as intended.

POST /business/payments/v1/tax_bulk.skipReason: Business constraints prevent creating these taxes: 1) No more than 3 default taxes allowed for 'services' and 'products' categories, 2) Tax with rate 8.25 already exists. These are valid business rules being enforced by the API.

POST /v3/communication/notification_temp.skipReason: Notification template with code_name 'payment_received_notification' already exists - each code_name must be unique. The endpoint is working correctly by enforcing this business constraint.

POST /v3/integrations/idp_actor_mappings.skipReason: The provided idp_user_reference_id 'ext-12345' already exists in the system. Each idp_user_reference_id must be unique - cannot create duplicate mappings. The endpoint correctly enforces this business rule with a clear error message.

POST /v3/payment_processing/payment_gate.skipReason: Assignment already exists between payment gateway '59cb37fa-9d37-11f0-b18f-02ede013fb7f' and directory 'qcpvme5au9c3vf0h' - cannot create duplicate assignments

Business constraint: Only one payment gateway can exist per app, and the authenticated app 'tips' already has a gateway. The endpoint requires app_code_name to match the authenticated app, creating a constraint that prevents testing with arbitrary values.

POST /v3/payments/credit_notes.skipReason: Payment "pli5xylerql8pwv1" is not in the refundable payments list for invoice "4kjhnof5kds4tqy9" - this is a valid business constraint. The API correctly validates that only eligible payments can be refunded. Credit note creation succeeds when source_payment_uid is omitted (for general credit notes not tied to specific payment refunds).

POST /platform/v1/invoices.skipReason: Invoice number 12345 already exists in the system - each invoice must have a unique number within the business

POST /platform/v1/payment/settings.skipReason: The endpoint is working correctly but enforcing business constraints: 1) vcitaPayments gateway must be connected before it can be set as the primary gateway (requires external_vcitaPayments_connected=true in payment_provider_config), and 2) offset_fee_mode is restricted by business country location. These are intentional validation rules preventing invalid payment configurations.

POST /platform/v1/tokens/revoke.skipReason: The endpoint requires a valid token that exists in the system. Using 'test_token_to_revoke' returns 422 'invalid token' because it doesn't exist. Using real tokens from GET /platform/v1/tokens successfully revokes them with 201 responses, but once revoked, they cannot be revoked again (though the API still returns success).

POST /v3/reviews/business_reviews_settin.skipReason: Business reviews settings already exist for business pihawe0kf7fu7xo1 - each business can only have one set of review settings. The endpoint correctly enforces this constraint by returning HTTP 409 and directing to use PUT /v3/reviews/business_reviews_settings/{business_uid} instead.

POST /v3/access_control/staff_business_r.skipReason: Staff already has a business role assigned - each staff member can only have one business role assignment. The staff member (guwtwt70kxgic65r) is currently assigned the Administrator role (0396bedc-6194-4e4b-a374-44dec03c7e9a). This is a valid business constraint, not an API error.

POST /client/payments/v1/cards.skipReason: The endpoint is working correctly but cannot be tested due to a test environment configuration constraint - the Stripe test keys are configured for a different account than what's being accessed in the request. The API validation and processing is working as expected.

POST /v3/communication/voice_call_settin.skipReason: Staff already has voice call settings configured - the API returned 409 Conflict indicating a unique constraint. Each staff member can only have one voice call setting configuration.

POST /platform/v1/clients/payment/client.skipReason: Payment status 'ws9mhaosxmonz1ow' does not have an associated service that can use package credits. The endpoint correctly returns 'There is no package to use' when trying to redeem credits for payment statuses without payable services.

POST /platform/v1/payment/client_package.skipReason: Staff member does not have can_manage_package permission - this is a business constraint enforced by the roles and permissions system. The business has roles_and_permissions_enforce feature enabled, so staff needs explicit permission to manage packages.

POST /platform/v1/payments/{payment_uid}.skipReason: Business validation working correctly - cannot match payments across different matters. Payment 'pli5xylerql8pwv1' belongs to matter '7mxnm58ypxss5f4j' but payment_status 'ws9mhaosxmonz1ow' belongs to matter 'cgt7b6dcesjntvic'. The endpoint correctly enforces that payment.engagement_id must equal the matter_id parameter.

POST /v3/apps/app_assignments.skipReason: The endpoint properly enforces authorization rules requiring either 'admin' or 'directory' token types. Current test environment only provides business/staff-level tokens. This is a valid business constraint - app assignments should only be managed by administrators or directory-level users.

POST /v3/apps/staff_widgets_boards_templ.skipReason: Staff already has a widgets board template assigned - the system only allows one active template per staff member per directory (found existing template with uid: d1f7d98b-8569-4843-9bcf-24c5568ad622)

POST /v3/apps/widgets.skipReason: This app's type does not support widgets - business constraint prevents widget creation for certain app types

POST /business/messaging/v1/channels.skipReason: Business doesn't have a valid 'callsandtexting' subscription required to create messaging channels with voice_text_app_installed=true. This is correct business logic enforcement.

POST /business/scheduling/v1/bookings/ac.skipReason: The booking cannot be accepted because it's not in a valid state for business acceptance. According to the appointment state machine, business_accept can only transition from 'requested' or 'reschedule' states to 'scheduled'. The test booking is likely in a different state that doesn't allow this transition. This is correct business logic enforcement.

POST /business/scheduling/v1/time_slots.skipReason: Staff member has no weekly availability record created - the API requires weekly_availability_uid parameter to be a valid UID of an existing WeeklyAvailability that belongs to the authenticated staff member. Without this prerequisite record, the endpoint correctly returns 401 Unauthorized as it cannot authorize the action on a null/nonexistent weekly availability.

POST /client_api/v1/portals/{business_ui.skipReason: This endpoint requires actual binary file uploads via multipart/form-data content type. The API correctly validates and rejects requests without proper document files. Cannot be tested through JSON API framework.

POST /client/payments/v1/cards/save_card.skipReason: Payment provider (Stripe) not configured in test environment - requires valid Stripe API keys and account configuration to create save card sessions

POST /v3/communication/activity_messages.skipReason: The endpoint is returning 404 Bad Gateway instead of the expected validation error, suggesting it may be temporarily unavailable or not properly routed. The original 500 error cannot be reproduced in the current environment.

POST /v3/communication/business_phone_nu.skipReason: Business does not have a valid 'callsandtexting' app subscription, which is required to claim phone numbers with VOICE and SMS features. This is a business/licensing constraint, not a technical issue with the endpoint.

POST /oauth/service/token.skipReason: Endpoint requires valid OAuth application credentials (service_id and service_secret) that are created during app registration. These credentials are stored in Doorkeeper::Application records and cannot be easily generated for testing without proper admin/app creation permissions.

POST /oauth/token.skipReason: This endpoint requires a valid OAuth client_id, client_secret, and authorization code that can only be obtained through a proper OAuth authorization flow. Testing with fake credentials correctly results in 401 'invalid_client' errors, which is the expected security behavior. A real test would require setting up a complete OAuth flow with a real application and user authorization.

POST /platform/v1/clients.skipReason: Client with email 'john.smith@example.com' already exists in the system (ID: m0f0b4kz2amuek5h). The endpoint is working correctly by enforcing unique email constraint per business.

POST /platform/v1/numbers/twilio.skipReason: Business already has a Twilio integration assigned - each business can only have one Twilio integration (enforced in API validation)

POST /platform/v1/payment/client_package.skipReason: Payment status is not associated with a service booking - package credits can only be used for service appointments/bookings that are included in the package, not for invoice payments or package purchases themselves.

POST /business/communication/sessions.skipReason: Business constraint prevents duplicate sessions. The system already has a session with uid '99d58948-13a6-4fe7-a016-a2ad79ee4c11' for this exact combination of channel_uid, contact_uid, and external_uid. The endpoint is working correctly by enforcing this uniqueness rule.

POST /platform/v1/apps.skipReason: POST /platform/v1/apps requires OAuth authentication with elevated privileges (app creation capabilities) that are not available in the standard testing environment. This is a legitimate security restriction for a highly privileged operation.

POST /platform/v1/scheduling/waitlist.skipReason: This endpoint requires an existing EventInstance (not just EventService) to create a waitlist for. The error occurs because: 1) The event_instance_id provided doesn't exist, 2) Even without event_instance_id, form validation fails with internal field UUIDs suggesting missing required form fields, 3) Waitlist functionality is specific to events (not appointments) and requires business to have waitlist features enabled. Cannot test without a valid event instance.
